articles.description: Chelsea manager Emma Hayes says her side were "robbed" of victory by "embarrassing" refereeing in their 2-2 draw with Real Madrid in the Women's Champions League.
articles.title: Chelsea 'robbed' by 'embarrassing' refereeing - Hayes

articles.description: India reach the World Cup final by holding off New Zealand on a memorable night in Mumbai that included Virat Kohli's record-breaking 50th one-day international century.
articles.title: India beat NZ to reach final after Kohli record century

articles.description: When Morocco beat Spain at last year's World Cup, it was a result that struck at the core of a long, complicated relationship between the two countries.
articles.title: A rivalry heated by history - the significance of Morocco's win over Spain

articles.description: A fired-up Anthony Joshua insists he is not past his peak and tells undercard fighter Jarrell Miller to "shut up" in a fiery news conference in London.
articles.title: Fired-up Joshua bites at Wallin, Miller & critics

articles.description: Chelsea could face further scrutiny from football's authorities over reports of payments connected to the club's former owner Roman Abramovich.
articles.title: Chelsea could face scrutiny over alleged Abramovich payments

articles.description: Ex-Charlton striker Kevin Lisbie could not bear to watch as his son Kyrell scores a penalty for Cray Valley Paper Mills to make it 1-1 in the FA Cup.
articles.title: 'Magic of the cup' - Pundit Lisbie can't watch son's penalty

articles.description: Captain Temba Bavuma says South Africa will acknowledge the "emotions" of their World Cup semi-final against Australia in Kolkata on Wednesday.
articles.title: South Africa acknowledge 'emotions' of semi-final

articles.description: Carlos Alcaraz gets his ATP Finals campaign back on track with a win over Andrey Rublev in which the Russian hit himself so hard he drew blood.
articles.title: Alcaraz beats frustrated Rublev at ATP Finals

articles.description: Ultra-marathon runner Joasia Zakrzewski is banned for 12 months by UK Athletics for using a car in a race.
articles.title: Runner banned for 12 months for using car in race

articles.description: Virat Kohli hits a record-breaking century and Mohammed Shami claims 7-57 to help India book their place in the Cricket World Cup final after a 70-run victory over New Zealand in Mumbai.
articles.title: Kohli and Shami lead India to World Cup final
